intro: Cheiranthus arkansanus, commonly known as the Arkansas poppy, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in prairie and woodland habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its bright yellow or orange flowers bloom in early spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The Arkansas poppy is also valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
